content.text: Find the percentage of students who choose chemistry
Find the fraction of students who choose physics
Give your answer in its simplest form
For the number of students choosing each subject, find the ratio biology : chemistry : physics. Give your answer in its simplest form
Marcus says:
‘I do not know how many people choose chemistry, but I do know it is an even number.’
Explain how Marcus knows this
Claudia now tells Marcus that 26 students choose chemistry
Work out how many students choose physics
Claudia asks some students to choose their favourite science from biology, chemistry and physics. The pie chart shows the results
Work out the number of students in the class
Find \(\mathrm{n}(G)\)
One of the students is chosen at random
Find the probability that this student studies geography and history
One of the students who studies geography and history stops studying history
Complete this Venn diagram to show this change
The Venn diagram shows information about the number of students in a class who study geography \((G)\) and history \((H)\)
Bananas cost \(1.20 per kilogram and apples cost\) 2.25 per bag
Work out the total cost of \(3.5 \text{kg}\) of bananas and 2 bags of apples
Students receive a \(10\%\) discount on their shopping
Before the discount, the cost of a student's shopping is \(\) 16.80\$
Work out the amount of the discount
The cost of a cabbage increases by \(15\%
Calculate the new price if the original price is \(\) 1.80\$

Some customers have their shopping delivered to their home
The cost is \(\) 5\(plus\) \ \(1.50\) for each kilometre travelled from the shop to their home

Suki has \(20

He has 240 sticks left to make the remaining 7 diagrams
